intro: Cyclophorus flocciger, commonly known as the woolly cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, white to grayish fuzzy covering on its stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or pale yellow in color. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Cyclophorus flocciger is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
